The alpha family

Feb 12, 2020

This is going to be a short post. Arun Debray motivated me to write this down.

Adams (and Toda) constructed an infinite family . It was later proved (I don’t know by whom) that these elements all live on the -sphere (localized at ): . For instance, is the first attaching map in . There’s a simple construction of this family that I’d like to decribe today.

Let’s -localize all our spaces and maps. Consider the unstable map . This defines a map , and hence an -map . By adjunction, we obtain a map . The James splitting gives an equivalence

and so we obtain maps . By adjunction, this gives a map , i.e., an element of . This element is the unstable map .
